data.title: Navitas Semiconductor Corp SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Navitas Semiconductor Corp, a leading provider of next-generation power semiconductors, has released its annual 10-K report, detailing significant financial and operational highlights for the fiscal year. The report underscores the company's strategic pivot towards high-power markets, including AI data centers, energy and grid infrastructure, performance computing, and industrial electrification, while also addressing the challenges and risks associated with this transition.

Financial Highlights

  • Net Revenues: $45.9 million, a decrease of 45% from the previous year, primarily due to a decline in the mobile and consumer markets in China.
  • Cost of Revenues: $31.7 million, decreased by 42% compared to the previous year, driven by lower sales volume and the absence of a $5.0 million inventory reserve recorded in the prior year.
  • Loss from Operations: $(107.8) million, improved by 18% from the previous year, reflecting cost reductions in research and development and selling, general and administrative expenses.
  • Net Loss: $(117.0) million, increased by 38% from the previous year, impacted by a $12.4 million loss from the change in fair value of earnout liabilities.
  • Basic Net Loss Per Share Attributable to Common Stockholders: $(0.57), compared to $(0.46) in the previous year, reflecting the increased net loss.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: Navitas Semiconductor focuses on high-power markets, including AI data centers, energy and grid infrastructure, performance computing, and industrial electrification. The company has de-emphasized mobile and consumer products, reflecting a strategic pivot towards these high-margin markets.
  • Geographical Performance: In 2025, revenue distribution shifted significantly, with the United States accounting for 28% of revenue, up from 16% in 2024. Conversely, revenue from China decreased from 60% to 47%, indicating a strategic realignment and focus on other regions.
  • Sales Units: As of December 31, 2025, Navitas shipped over 300 million GaN devices and nearly 30 million SiC devices, demonstrating the company's capability to produce and deliver high volumes of next-generation power semiconductors.
  • New Product Launches: Navitas has developed a broad line of GaN power devices and ICs, offering optimal choices for high-power-density chargers and AI data centers, reflecting the company's commitment to innovation in high-power applications.
  • Future Outlook: The company anticipates a multi-year growth trend in high-power markets as GaN and SiC technologies replace existing silicon devices. The AI data center revolution is expected to be a primary catalyst for this growth, alongside grid modernization and industrial electrification.
  • Operational Strategy: Navitas operates a fabless business model, outsourcing wafer fabrication and other functions to third-party partners, allowing for faster scaling and lower capital expenses. This model supports the company's focus on high-power markets and strategic partnerships.
  • Competitive Advantages: Navitas is uniquely positioned as a pure-play next-generation high-power semiconductor company, offering both GaN and high-voltage SiC products. This dual capability allows the company to address a full range of high-power use cases, providing a competitive edge in emerging markets.

Strategic Initiatives

  • Navitas 2.0 Restructuring Plan: Navitas Semiconductor Corporation undertook the Navitas 2.0 Restructuring Plan to reposition itself as a focused high-power semiconductor company. This strategic transformation involved shifting away from consumer-oriented segments towards long-term programs in AI data centers, energy and grid infrastructure, performance computing, and industrial electrification. The plan included distributor rationalization, resource realignment, technology roadmap acceleration, and go-to-market restructuring. These actions are aimed at improving business predictability, expanding gross margin, and supporting a scalable and sustainable operating model.
  • Capital Management: Navitas executed a private placement of approximately 14.8 million shares of Class A common stock at $6.75 per share, resulting in gross proceeds of approximately $100 million. Additionally, the company completed two 'At the Market' (ATM) offerings, raising approximately $100 million in total. These capital management activities were aimed at bolstering working capital and supporting strategic initiatives in high-power markets. The company also reported a significant increase in cash and cash equivalents, driven by these equity financing activities, which increased from $86.7 million at the end of 2024 to $236.9 million at the end of 2025.
  • Future Outlook: Navitas plans to continue focusing on high-power markets, leveraging its expertise in GaN and SiC technologies. The company expects to maintain a disciplined operating model centered on market focus, technology leadership, operational efficiency, and financial discipline. It anticipates that its current levels of cash and cash equivalents will be sufficient to finance operations, working capital requirements, and capital expenditures for the foreseeable future. The company also expects to continue incurring net operating losses and negative cash flows from operations in the near term, with research and development expenses, general and administrative expenses, and capital expenditures remaining relatively flat.

Challenges and Risks

  • Strategic Shift Risks: The company faces significant challenges due to its strategic shift towards AI data centers, energy and grid infrastructure, performance computing, and industrial electrification. This transition involves operational, technical, and market risks, including the need to develop semiconductor solutions that meet demanding power and efficiency requirements, compete against established incumbents, and secure design wins in new market segments. The shift may also require additional capital, which may not be available on favorable terms.
  • Supply Chain Risks: The company is exposed to supply chain risks, particularly due to its reliance on single sources for certain manufacturing services and materials. The announcement by TSMC to cease GaN production by 2027 poses a significant risk, despite mitigation efforts such as partnerships with Powerchip and GlobalFoundries. Any delays or disruptions in transitioning to new suppliers could negatively impact the company's ability to fulfill customer orders.
  • Geopolitical and Regulatory Risks: Geopolitical and regulatory risks are heightened due to the company's international operations, particularly in Asia. New U.S. government regulations restricting outbound investments in China could impact the company's strategic investments and partnerships, potentially affecting growth and competitive positioning.
  • Financial Risks: Financial risks include the unpredictability of working capital needs and the potential requirement for additional capital to support business growth. The company also faces challenges in maintaining effective internal controls, which could impact investor confidence and stock price.
  • Cybersecurity Risks: Cybersecurity risks are significant, with the company subject to sophisticated cyber attacks that could result in the theft or unauthorized disclosure of intellectual property and customer data. The company has experienced attempted cyber attacks, highlighting the need for ongoing enhancements to cybersecurity measures.
  • Tax Risks: Tax risks are present due to potential changes in domestic and international tax laws, which could adversely affect the company's financial condition. The company's status as an inverted domestic corporation under the Homeland Security Act may limit its ability to enter into U.S. government contracts, potentially decreasing the value of its business.
  • Market Risks: The company is exposed to market risks, including foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect financial results. The semiconductor sector's cyclical volatility, especially in new and emerging markets, adds to the unpredictability of future revenues and profits.

SEC Filing: Navitas Semiconductor Corp [ NVTS ] - 10-K - Feb. 27, 2026

data.title: DANA Inc SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
DANA Inc, a global leader in drivetrain and e-Propulsion systems, has released its 2025 Form 10-K report, detailing significant financial improvements, strategic initiatives, and operational highlights. The report underscores the company's focus on core on-highway markets and its commitment to technological innovation and operational efficiency.

Financial Highlights

Net Sales: $7,500 million, reflecting a decrease of $234 million from 2024 due to lower production volumes in North America and South America, partially offset by pricing actions and recoveries.

Gross Margin: $602 million, representing 8.0% of net sales, an increase of 310 basis points from 2024, driven by cost reduction initiatives and operational efficiencies.

Earnings (loss) from continuing operations before interest and income taxes: $139 million, a significant improvement from a loss of $176 million in 2024, due to cost reduction initiatives and improved operational performance.

Net Income (Loss) from Continuing Operations: $(53) million, an improvement from a loss of $342 million in 2024, reflecting better operational performance and cost management.

Net Income from Discontinued Operations: $155 million, primarily due to the divestiture of the Off-Highway business.

Net Income (Loss): $102 million, compared to a loss of $49 million in 2024, driven by gains from discontinued operations.

Net Income (Loss) Attributable to the Parent Company: $85 million, compared to a loss of $57 million in 2024.

Basic Earnings (Loss) Per Share: $0.64, compared to $(0.39) in 2024, reflecting improved net income.

Diluted Earnings (Loss) Per Share: $0.64, compared to $(0.39) in 2024, indicating improved profitability.

Business Highlights

Revenue Segments: Dana Incorporated operates through two main segments: Light Vehicle Drive Systems and Commercial Vehicle Drive and Motion Systems. In 2025, the Light Vehicle segment accounted for 70% of sales, while the Commercial Vehicle segment contributed 30%.

Geographical Performance: In 2025, 60% of Dana's sales were generated from North American operations, with the remaining 40% coming from international markets. Sales in Europe and Asia Pacific were impacted by lower electric vehicle product orders, while South America saw a decrease in medium/heavy-duty production volumes.

Sales Units: The Light Vehicle segment experienced a 1% decrease in sales volumes in 2025 due to lower production volumes in North America and reduced electric vehicle product orders in Europe and Asia Pacific. The Commercial Vehicle segment saw an 8% decrease in sales volumes, reflecting weaker global markets.

New Product Launches: Dana continues to focus on technological innovation, with ongoing research and development efforts aimed at enhancing efficiency, performance, and safety in both internal combustion and electric vehicle technologies.

Future Outlook: For 2026, Dana anticipates sales between $7,300 and $7,700 million, with adjusted EBITDA expected to range from $750 to $850 million. The company plans to realize $200 million of its sales backlog in 2026, with further incremental sales expected in subsequent years.

Operational Efficiency: Dana has implemented cost reduction initiatives expected to deliver annualized savings of $325 million through 2026, with $260 million realized by the end of 2025. These initiatives include reducing selling, general, and administrative costs and aligning engineering expenses with industry dynamics.

Customer Dependence: Dana's largest customers include Ford Motor Company and Stellantis N.V., which together accounted for a significant portion of sales. The company emphasizes the importance of maintaining these relationships while expanding its customer base.

Engineering and R&D: Dana invested $105 million in research and development in 2025, focusing on advancements in powertrain systems, vehicle dynamics, and thermal management. The company is also leveraging AI and machine learning to enhance product development and performance.

Human Capital: As of December 31, 2025, Dana employed approximately 26,900 people globally, with a focus on safety, inclusion, and integrity. The company is committed to providing competitive compensation and benefits to attract and retain talent.

Environmental Compliance: Dana's capital expenditures include investments to ensure compliance with environmental laws and regulations, which have not materially impacted earnings or competitive position.

Strategic Initiatives

Strategic Initiatives: Dana Incorporated has embarked on a strategic plan to focus on core on-highway markets, which includes the divestiture of its Off-Highway business to Allison Transmission Holdings, Inc. This move is aimed at creating a more focused and nimble organization. The company is also pursuing cost reduction initiatives, which include a substantial reduction in selling, general, and administrative costs, and aligning engineering expenses to match current industry dynamics. Additionally, Dana is focusing on aftermarket growth opportunities and selective acquisitions that align with its core businesses.

Capital Management: Dana has utilized the net cash proceeds from the Off-Highway business divestiture to pay down debt, strengthening its financial position, and providing capital returns to shareholders. The company has repurchased $750 million worth of its own shares under the approved stock repurchase program and has increased the share repurchase program to a total of $2 billion through the end of 2030. Furthermore, Dana has made significant debt repayments, including the redemption of senior notes and repayment of the Term A Facility, to improve its capital structure.

Future Outlook: Dana plans to continue its focus on core on-highway markets and accelerate value creation by improving its cost structure and increasing efficiency. The company expects to realize additional annualized savings from its cost reduction initiatives through 2026. Dana also aims to leverage its strong technology foundation to expand its global markets and deliver innovative solutions for the mobility markets it serves. The company anticipates generating free cash flow of $300 million at the midpoint of its guidance range for 2026, reflecting higher adjusted EBITDA and lower income tax and interest payments.

Challenges and Risks

Market-Related Risks: Dana faces several market-related risks, including a downturn in the global economy, which could adversely affect vehicle demand and, consequently, the company's business. Climate change and related regulations could increase operating costs due to potential carbon pricing mechanisms and facility improvements. Public health crises, such as pandemics, pose risks of operational disruptions and supply chain challenges.

Financial Risks: Rising interest rates could impact Dana's ability to obtain financing at attractive rates, affecting growth strategies. The company is also vulnerable to the loss of significant customers, which could materially impact financial results. Changes in international legislative and political conditions, including trade policies and tariffs, could disrupt operations and increase costs.

Operational Risks: Dana's operations are exposed to foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations, particularly with 43% of sales from non-U.S. operations. Strengthening of the U.S. dollar could adversely affect results. The company also faces regulatory risks related to increased fuel economy standards and greenhouse gas emissions, which could alter customer product development plans and increase costs.

Company-Specific Risks: Challenges in realizing cost savings from restructuring actions, dependency on subsidiaries for cash flow, and potential labor stoppages are significant risks. Dana is also exposed to risks from commodity price volatility, supply chain disruptions, and program launch difficulties.

Intellectual Property and Compliance Risks: The company must protect its intellectual property and manage integration challenges from acquisitions and joint ventures. Environmental, health, safety, and product liability compliance costs could increase, impacting profitability. Cybersecurity threats and the use of AI and machine learning present operational and regulatory risks.

Management Strategies: Dana's strategic initiatives include cost reduction and segment realignment to enhance profitability and cash flow. The company is focusing on aftermarket opportunities and selective acquisitions to drive growth. However, the transition from internal combustion engine vehicles to electric vehicles presents both opportunities and challenges, including increased competition and the need for significant R&D investment.

Market Outlook: The company anticipates a stable outlook for light vehicle markets in 2026, with marginal improvements in Europe and South America. However, commercial vehicle markets face challenges, with expected declines in Class-8 truck production in North America. Foreign currency movements and commodity costs remain significant factors affecting financial performance.

SEC Filing: DANA Inc [ DAN ] - 10-K - Feb. 27, 2026

data.title: Correction — GREEN RAIN ENERGY HOLDINGS (OTCID: GREH) Provides Corporate Update: Finalized Special Stock Dividend, Voluntary Stock Buyback Program, and Strategic Growth Initiatives
data.description:
(14:00 GMT) *GREEN RAIN ENERGY HOLDINGS (OTCID: GREH) Provides Corporate Update: Finalized Special Stock Dividend, Voluntary Stock Buyback Program, And Strategic Growth Initiatives >GREH
(14:00 GMT) Press Release: GREEN RAIN ENERGY HOLDINGS (OTCID: GREH) Provides Corporate Update: Finalized Special Stock Dividend, Voluntary Stock Buyback Program, and Strategic Growth Initiatives

BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Feb. 25, 2026 /PRNewswire/ — Green Rain Energy Holdings (OTCID: GREH) ("Green Rain Energy," "GREH," or the "Company") is pleased to provide shareholders with a significant corporate update highlighting strategic actions designed to strengthen shareholder alignment, optimize the Company's capital structure, and support long-term value creation.

Special Stock Dividend Finalized — Record Date March 31, 2025

The Company has finalized the structure of its previously announced special stock dividend, subject to customary regulatory approvals.

Dividend Details

Dividend Ratio: One (1) share of restricted common stock for every 100 shares of common stock held.

Record Date: March 31, 2025

Shareholder Action Required: None — no action or vote is required

Regulatory Status: Implementation remains subject to customary approval from FINRA.

Fractional Shares: Fractional shares will not be issued; amounts will be rounded up to the next highest whole share.

Tax Treatment: The distribution is intended to qualify as tax-free for U.S. federal income tax purposes.

Legal counsel is finalizing required submissions and will file all applicable documentation with FINRA in the coming days.

Strategic Purpose of the Dividend

Unlike traditional distributions designed solely to reward holders, this stock dividend is intended to strategically align shareholders with the Company's next phase of expansion by:

  • Broadening long-term shareholder participation in anticipated corporate growth.
  • Supporting capital structure stability while preserving cash resources for execution.
  • Enhancing shareholder alignment with strategic acquisitions and operational expansion initiatives.
  • Management believes this dividend structure allows shareholders to participate more directly in the Company's long-term growth trajectory while reinforcing confidence in future execution.

Voluntary Stock Buyback Program Finalized

The Company further announces that its voluntary stock buyback program has been finalized following formal approval by the Board of Directors.

Program Overview

Available to shareholders holding up to 2,500 common shares

Eligible participants may sell shares directly to the Company at a fixed price of $0.045 per share, consistent with the Company's amended Regulation A offering price

Program start date: April 1, 2026

Program expiration date: June 30, 2026

An independent escrow agent will be engaged to administer and facilitate the transaction

Any repurchased shares will be cancelled and returned to the Company's corporate treasury, thereby reducing the number of issued and outstanding shares and supporting long-term shareholder value through potential reduction in dilution.

The Company cautions that there is no assurance the program will be approved or implemented as described, and any such program will be conducted in full compliance with applicable securities laws and regulations.

Strategic Corporate Developments

Green Rain Energy continues to advance a number of initiatives expected to strengthen the Company's long-term position, including:

Ongoing updates regarding the proposed acquisition of Chronicle Electric Inc.

Settlement and mitigation arrangements involving outstanding convertible debt instruments designed to improve balance sheet stability.

Continued progress on project development and expansion initiatives.

Management will continue to provide updates as material developments occur.

Management Commentary

"These initiatives represent a balanced approach to shareholder value creation," said Alfredo Papadakis CEO of the company. "By finalizing both the stock dividend and the voluntary buyback program, we are demonstrating confidence in the Company's long-term strategy while maintaining a disciplined focus on capital management. Combined with acquisition opportunities and continued operational development, we believe Green Rain Energy is positioning itself as a compelling long-term value investment."

About Green Rain Energy Holdings Inc.

Green Rain Energy Holdings Inc. (OTCID: GREH) is a holding company focused on opportunities in renewable energy and related sustainable technologies. The Company seeks to identify, acquire, and develop assets that align with long-term trends in clean energy and environmental responsibility.

Visit: https://greenrainenergy.com/

Investor Relations: https://greenrainenergy.com/investor-relations/

Follow us on X (Twitter): https://x.com/GreenRainEnergy

Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61580025893268&mibextid=wwXIfr

Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/green.rain.energy/?igsh=MW9jY3g0MmZiaG5pNg%3D%3D&utm_source=qr#

Follow us on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@GreenRainEnergy

Forward Looking Statements:

This release contains forward-looking statements under Sections 27A and 21E of U.S. securities laws, subject to safe harbor provisions. These statements involve risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially, including technical, permitting, or other challenges. Green Rain Energy assumes no obligation to update forward-looking statements except as required by law.

View original content to download multimedia:https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/green-rain-energy-holdings-otcid-greh-provides-corporate-update-finalized-special-stock-dividend-voluntary-stock-buyback-program-and-strategic-growth-initiatives-302696835.html

SOURCE Green Rain Energy Holdings, Inc.

data.title: US says research funding into new farm practices to surpass $1 billion
data.description:
The United States will invest over $1 billion in research into new and sustainable farm practices, following an additional $200 million in funding, the Environmental Protection Agency as well as the departments of Agriculture and Health and Human Services said in a joint statement on Friday.

The administration is pushing efforts to reduce the usage of pesticides by finding alternatives.

data.title: Tesla Delays Deliveries For Cheapest Cybertruck Until 2027
data.description:
Key points:
  • Earlier this week, the company said that the price on the cheapest variant will increase after Feb. 28.
  • Musk had previously predicted that Tesla could sell up to 500,000 Cybertrucks annually.
  • However, the vehicle is yet to breach 100,000 deliveries a year.

Customers ordering Tesla Inc.’s (TSLA) cheapest Cybertruck variant will have to wait until the next year to have it delivered, the company’s website now shows.

Tesla’s website has been updated to reflect delivery wait time until 2027 for zip codes in Texas as well as California for its Dual Motor all-wheel drive (AWD) variant launched last week, implying significant demand.

The Cheapest Cybertruck

The lower-price Dual Motor AWD variant of the Cybertruck priced at $59,990 was unveiled last week. Tesla now offers three versions of the vehicles including the premium all-wheel drive and Cyberbeast variants priced at $79,990 and $99,990, respectively.

Earlier this week, the company said that the price on the cheapest variant will increase after Feb. 28. The company, however, did not provide a new price point.

Tesla started delivering the Cybertruck in Nov. 2023 after a long wait. However, the truck was pricier than proposed during its unveiling in 2019, dragging down demand and preventing reservation holders from actually placing the order.

Musk had said in 2019 that the entry-level variant of the truck would start at about $40,000, while the most premium version would start at around $70,000. The Cybertruck’s stainless steel exterior and angular design also pulled split opinions, with some deeming it ugly, while others appreciated the change.

Musk had previously predicted that Tesla could sell up to 500,000 Cybertrucks annually. However, in 2025, the company sold only 50,850 units of all its premium models combined, which includes the Model S, X and the Cybertruck, putting Cybertruck annual sales alone at below 20,000 units on an estimate.

Late last year, Tesla also launched cheaper variants of both of its top-selling Model 3 sedan and Model Y SUV models.

How Did Stocktwits Users React?

On Stocktwits, retail sentiment around TSLA stock stayed within the ‘extremely bullish’ territory while message volume stayed at ‘low’ levels.

TSLA stock has gained 42% over the past 12 months.

data.title: US dollar rises on higher PPI and US-Iran tensions
data.description:
Key points:
  • PPI rises 0.5% in January, exceeding expectations
  • Dollar gains amid US-Iran tensions and potential conflict
  • Dollar index heads for first monthly gain since October

By Karen Brettell

The U.S. dollar was headed for its first monthly gain since October on Friday, although an earlier rally on hotter-than-expected producer price data for January faded as traders squared positions for the month-end and ahead of the weekend.

The U.S. currency got a boost after data showed the Producer Price Index for final demand rose 0.5% last month. Economists polled by Reuters had forecast the PPI gaining 0.3% after a previously reported 0.5% increase in December.

"There's a real deep unease in markets about inflation and growth so far in 2026," said Adam Button, chief currency analyst at investingLive. "There's this expectation that inflation will moderate, but it's not showing up in the numbers."

Underneath the headline number, however, there were signs of improvement, said Chris Low, chief economist at FHN Financial.

"While the PPI headline increase was alarmingly big, pressure came from trade services, a category the BLS notes is calculated in a way that does not capture true price changes in real time," Low said in a report. "Otherwise, there is evidence of price moderation."

DOLLAR TRACKS FIRST MONTHLY GAIN SINCE OCTOBER

The dollar index , which measures the greenback against a basket of currencies including the yen and the euro, fell 0.12% to 97.61, with the euro up 0.18% at $1.1818.

The dollar index is headed for a 0.47% monthly gain, its first monthly increase since October. The euro is on track for a 0.25% loss, its first down month since October.

Against the Japanese yen , the dollar weakened 0.1% to 155.95. The U.S. currency is headed for a 0.78% gain against the yen this month.

The U.S. Federal Reserve is expected to keep rates on hold until at least June due to concerns about elevated inflation.

But traders are pricing in 62 basis points of cuts by year-end on concerns about a weakening labor market.

The dollar was also boosted earlier by safety bids on concerns about a conflict between the U.S. and Iran.

The two countries made progress in talks over Tehran's nuclear program on Thursday, mediator Oman said, but hours of negotiation ended with no sign of a breakthrough that could avert potential U.S. strikes amid a massive military buildup.

Oil prices rose about 2% on Friday as traders remained on alert for potential supply disruptions if relations worsen.

Overall market moves this week have been muted as traders gauge the geopolitical uncertainty along with the impact of new tariffs, after the U.S. Supreme Court last week struck down U.S. President Donald Trump's emergency tariffs.

"The dollar has been trading in a little bit of a holding pattern. It feels like it's waiting for its next real catalyst," said City Index market strategist Fiona Cincotta.

The yuan took a breather from a 10-day rally after the People's Bank of China moved to slow the pace of the rise. The central bank said it would scrap the foreign exchange risk reserves for some forward contracts, seen as a way to encourage dollar buying.

Sterling weakened 0.02% to $1.3478 and was set to snap three straight months of gains with a 1.53% fall in February.

A local election in Manchester on Thursday delivered a big victory to the Green Party and a blow to Prime Minister Keir Starmer's Labour, whose popularity has slid sharply in the past year.

Sterling is sensitive to domestic politics, but with risk events ahead, such as next week's budget update from finance minister Rachel Reeves, any volatility was contained.

In cryptocurrencies, bitcoin fell 3.08% to $65,399.

data.title: Xponential Fitness Plummets on 4Q Earnings Miss, Expected FY Rev Decline
data.description:
By Elias Schisgall

Shares of Xponential Fitness plummeted after the company reported a wider-than-expected fourth-quarter loss and guided for a 16% revenue decline for the full year.

Shares were down 48% to $4.21 in Friday afternoon trading after hitting a low of $4.06, their lowest point in at least five years. The stock is down 67% over the past 12 months.

The boutique fitness brands company on Thursday reported a loss of $32.9 million, or $1.17 a share, compared with a loss of $43.5 million, or $1.36 a share, a year earlier.

Stripping out certain one-time items, the company reported an adjusted loss of 91 cents a share. Analysts surveyed by FactSet were expecting an adjusted loss of 3 cents a share.

Revenue was $83 million, down slightly from $83.2 million a year earlier. Analysts were expecting $73.4 million.

For the current year, the company said it expects revenue to fall to between $260 million and $270 million, representing a 16% decline at the midpoint.

Write to Elias Schisgall at elias.schisgall@wsj.com

data.title: Key facts: Morgan Stanley expands Bitcoin services; announces early redemption
data.description:
• Morgan Stanley is pursuing Bitcoin yield and lending services, enhancing its digital asset strategy by hiring for crypto roles in Decentralized Finance (DeFi) and tokenization.1
  • Morgan Stanley B.V. announced an early redemption related to GEM_MSBV, scheduled for February 27, 2026, as reported through the Companies Announcement Service of Euronext Dublin.2

data.title: Key facts: Match Group posts $873M operating income; files mixed shelf offering
data.description:
• Match Group reported an operating income of $873 million, marking a 6% increase year-over-year, and a net income of $613 million, which reflects an 11% increase attributed to lower interest expenses.1
  • Match Group Inc. has filed for a mixed shelf offering, with the size of the offering not disclosed, according to a recent SEC filing.2

data.title: Key facts: Janux Therapeutics Receives Strong Buy Ratings; Partners with BMS
data.description:
• Janux Therapeutics (JANX) has 18 'strong buy' or 'buy' ratings and no 'sell' ratings. The median 12-month price target is $53.50, indicating a potential 74.4% upside from $13.70.1
  • Janux Therapeutics has partnered with Bristol Myers Squibb to develop a new tumor-activated therapy for solid tumors, with potential milestone payments of around $800 million.2

data.title: Key facts: ImmunityBio completes Phase 2 trial enrollment; conference call set
data.description:
• ImmunityBio has finished enrollment early in its Phase 2 Quilt 2.005 trial, evaluating Anktiva and BCG for early-stage bladder cancer, showing improved cancer-free rates.1
  • ImmunityBio, Inc. will hold a conference call on March 3, 2026, at 1:30 p.m. PT to discuss its 2025 financial results and updates on clinical trials.2

data.title: Key facts: HC Wainwright maintains 'Buy' on Energy Fuels; target raised to $27.25
data.description:
• HC Wainwright & Co. has maintained a 'Buy' rating for Energy Fuels (UUUU) and raised the price target to $27.25 per share, an increase from the previous target of $26.75.1
  • Analysts raised Energy Fuels Inc's earnings estimate by about 20% in three months. The current rating is 'buy' with 4 'strong buy' or 'buy' ratings and 1 'hold'.2

data.title: Key facts: Google invests $600B in AI; faces antitrust probe in Belgium
data.description:
• Google (Alphabet) joins major tech firms in a $600 billion AI investment this year, expected to impact various sectors like semiconductors and utilities.1
  • Belgium's competition authority is investigating Google's ad pricing, citing possible antitrust violations amid concerns over increasing online advertising costs.2
  • Google has signed a multibillion-dollar deal with Meta to lease its Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) for advanced AI model development, highlighting major tech firms' investment in AI.34

data.title: Key facts: Goldman Sachs trades below peak; faces no redemption issues
data.description:
• Goldman Sachs (GS) trades at $870, about 10% below its peak of $1,000. A bearish head-and-shoulders pattern indicates a potential drop below $875, possibly losing 100 points.1
  • Goldman Sachs reported that it is not facing the same challenges as its private credit peers, who are currently dealing with redemptions.2
  • Goldman Sachs' exposure to enterprise software credit was 15.5% at Q3's end, lower than peers. The firm has evaluated AI's potential risks to established software firms.3

data.title: Key facts: Frontline Plc sells eight ECO VLCCs for $831.5M; acquires nine new ones for $1.2B
data.description:
• Frontline Plc is selling eight older ECO VLCCs for $831.5 million and acquiring nine new scrubber-fitted ECO VLCCs for $1,224.0 million.1
  • Frontline Plc has a 'strong buy' rating from analysts, with a 12-month price target of $30.00, about 24.3% below its last close of $37.28.2
  • Frontline anticipates lower spot time charter equivalents (TCEs) in Q1 2026 due to ballast days, while noting a constructive market environment driven by oil demand and fleet supply imbalance.3

data.title: Key facts: Broadcom to report earnings March 4; 2nm SoC shipping soon
data.description:
• Broadcom (AVGO) will report earnings on March 4, 2026, with an options market implied volatility of 8.64%, indicating expected price movement.1
  • Broadcom is scheduled to release its quarterly earnings report on Wednesday, attracting attention from Wall Street for insights into the effects of artificial intelligence on the semiconductor sector.2
  • Broadcom has started shipping its first 2nm custom compute SoC using the 3.5D eXtreme Dimension System in Package (XDSiP) platform, boosting power efficiency and lowering latency for AI clusters.3

data.title: Key facts: Applied Optoelectronics boosts R&D; Needham raises price target; Q1 2026 revenue forecast at $150-$165 million
data.description:
• Applied Optoelectronics is boosting manufacturing and R&D to enhance growth, focusing on high-speed data center products and DOCSIS 4.0 compatible CATV products.1
  • Needham has raised the price target for Applied Optoelectronics (AAOI) shares to $80.00 from a previous target of $43.00, while maintaining a 'Buy' rating.2
  • Applied Optoelectronics forecasts Q1 2026 revenue of $150-$165 million, with a non-GAAP gross margin of 29%-31% and a net income loss of $7.0-$0.3 million.3

data.title: Key facts: Amazon to invest $200B in AI; partners with OpenAI; cuts 16K jobs
data.description:
• Amazon plans to invest $200 billion in capital projects by 2026, focusing on developing AI models with its Trainium and Inferentia processors to cut costs and reduce reliance on Nvidia.1
  • OpenAI and Amazon are partnering to create a developer environment using OpenAI models on Amazon Web Services' Bedrock, launching soon and designed for easy AI integration.2
  • On January 28, Amazon announced a reduction of 16,000 corporate jobs as part of an initiative focused on AI and efficiency improvements, with the potential for additional job cuts in the future.3

data.title: Corn, soybean bids flat-higher as futures firm
data.description:
Spot basis bids for corn and soybeans were mostly steady, though soybean bids ticked up at a handful of locations as demand improved.

  • Soybeans held firm near a 20-month peak as investors weighed likely strong demand from biofuels makers against uncertainty about purchases by top importer China and a likely record harvest in Brazil.

  • A Reuters report on Thursday, which said that the U.S. administration plans to require big oil refineries to make up for at least half of the biofuel blending exemptions, reinforced expectations that upcoming revisions to U.S. biofuel policy will boost demand for feedstocks like soyoil.

  • The soybean basis rose at a Sioux City, Iowa, crush plant.

  • The corn and soybean basis rose at an Illinois river terminal.

data.title: FIVE STAR BANCORP SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Five Star Bancorp, headquartered in the greater Sacramento metropolitan area, has released its 2025 10-K report, showcasing a year of robust financial growth and strategic expansion. Operating through its wholly owned subsidiary, Five Star Bank, the company provides a broad range of banking products and services to small and medium-sized businesses, professionals, and individuals primarily in Northern California. The report highlights significant financial achievements, business developments, strategic initiatives, and the challenges and risks faced by the company.

Financial Highlights

  • Net Interest Income: $151.9 million, increased by $32.2 million or 26.89% compared to the previous year, primarily due to higher average balances and yields on loans.
  • Net Income: $61.6 million, increased from $45.7 million in the previous year, reflecting a 34.9% growth driven by higher net interest income.
  • Basic Earnings Per Common Share: $2.90, up from $2.26 in the previous year, indicating improved profitability per share.
  • Diluted Earnings Per Common Share: $2.90, consistent with basic earnings, reflecting no significant dilution effects.
  • Provision for Credit Losses: $9.7 million, increased by $2.8 million or 39.57% due to loan growth and higher loss rates.
  • Non-interest Income: $6.5 million, a slight increase of 1.27% from the previous year, with gains in loan-related fees and earnings on BOLI.
  • Non-interest Expense: $65.0 million, increased by 19.30% due to higher salaries, data processing costs, and professional services.
  • Net Interest Margin: 3.55%, increased by 23 basis points, reflecting improved interest income relative to interest-earning assets.

Business Highlights

  • Company Overview: Five Star Bancorp operates through its wholly owned subsidiary, Five Star Bank, providing a broad range of banking products and services to small and medium-sized businesses, professionals, and individuals primarily in Northern California through nine branch offices.
  • Geographical Performance: The company's principal geographic market is the Greater Sacramento Area, which has a profitable economy driven by sectors such as government, education, technology, healthcare, agriculture, and manufacturing. The company has expanded into the San Francisco Bay Area, opening a full-service branch in Walnut Creek in September 2025.
  • Product and Service Offerings: Five Star Bank focuses on commercial lending, with an emphasis on commercial real estate. The bank offers a variety of loans, including commercial real estate, commercial land and construction, farmland, and SBA loans. The bank also provides a comprehensive array of deposit products, including checking and savings accounts, time deposits, and money market accounts.
  • New Branch Launch: In September 2025, Five Star Bank opened a new full-service branch in Walnut Creek, California, as part of its expansion into the San Francisco Bay Area.
  • Lending Activities: As of December 31, 2025, the bank had $3.3 billion in commercial real estate loans, $98.1 million in commercial land and construction loans, $46.0 million in residential real estate and construction loans, $59.6 million in farmland loans, $292.2 million in commercial loans, and $34.3 million in SBA loans.
  • Deposit Products: As of December 31, 2025, the bank held total deposits of $4.2 billion, with $1.1 billion in non-interest-bearing deposits. The bank emphasizes obtaining deposit relationships at loan origination and provides a high level of customer service to its depositors.
  • Future Outlook: The company plans to continue its organic growth through a purpose-driven and integrity-centered approach to banking, focusing on expanding operations in unique lines of business, deepening client relationships, and engaging in the economic development of its communities and market areas.

Strategic Initiatives

  • Strategic Initiatives: The company aims to grow organically by leveraging its core competencies, focusing on expanding operations in unique lines of business, and enhancing its brand to deepen client relationships. It plans to attract additional banking professionals, maintain disciplined credit underwriting, and leverage technology to improve efficiency. The company also intends to engage in economic development within its communities and market areas.
  • Capital Management: The company increased its shareholders' equity to $445.8 million, primarily through net income of $61.6 million, offset by $17.1 million in cash dividends. It maintains a strong liquidity position with cash and cash equivalents representing 12.06% of total deposits. The company has a shelf registration statement allowing for the offer and sale of up to $300 million in securities, providing flexibility for future capital raising. Additionally, the company paid $17.1 million in dividends during 2025 and plans to continue quarterly cash dividends.
  • Future Outlook: The company projects spending $0.5 million on IT systems and $21.4 million on dividends in 2026. It expects to maintain its liquidity position to support growth and meet cash needs. The company plans to continue its current dividend practice, subject to board discretion, and aims to balance business management with returning earnings to shareholders. The company also anticipates maintaining its loan portfolio growth while managing product and geographic concentrations.

Challenges and Risks

  • Challenges and Risks: The company faces significant risks due to its concentration in Northern California, making it sensitive to local economic downturns. The competitive landscape is intensifying with both traditional and new financial services providers, including fintech companies offering alternative banking products. Regulatory compliance remains a challenge, with stringent capital requirements and consumer protection laws impacting operations. Cybersecurity threats and data privacy concerns are critical, as breaches could damage reputation and financial standing.
  • The company is also exposed to interest rate risks, which could affect profitability due to the mismatch in the repricing of assets and liabilities. Inflationary pressures could further impact costs and customer repayment abilities. The reliance on small to medium-sized businesses, which have fewer resources to withstand economic pressures, adds to credit risk. Additionally, the real estate market's volatility, particularly in commercial real estate, poses a risk due to potential declines in property values and increased loan defaults.
  • Management acknowledges the heightened competition and regulatory scrutiny as significant challenges. Strategies to address these include enhancing technological capabilities to improve customer service and operational efficiency. The company is also focusing on diversifying its geographic footprint to mitigate regional economic risks. Efforts are being made to strengthen cybersecurity measures and data protection protocols to safeguard against breaches.
  • The company is exposed to market risks, particularly interest rate fluctuations, which could impact net interest income. The recent bank failures have heightened awareness around liquidity and deposit composition, necessitating careful liquidity management. The company is actively monitoring these risks and adjusting its asset-liability management strategies to mitigate potential adverse effects on financial performance.

SEC Filing: FIVE STAR BANCORP [ FSBC ] - 10-K - Feb. 27, 2026

data.title: Goldman bucks private credit redemption trend as AI disruption fears mount
data.description:
By Manya Saini

Goldman Sachs' asset management arm has assured investors that the redemption rate at GS Credit remains well below that of its peers, setting it apart from turbulence in private credit sparked by concerns that AI could disrupt software companies.

In a letter to investors seen by Reuters on Friday, the Wall Street firm added that Goldman Sachs Private Credit Corp continued to see strong appetite, with December inflows 11% above the year-to-date average and a fourth-quarter redemption rate of 3.5%, compared with more than 5% for peers.

Fears that AI could erode the earnings power of software companies and weaken their ability to repay loans are rippling through private credit, a key lender to the technology sector, prompting investors to reassess exposure, redemption risks and fundraising prospects, analysts have said.

Concerns have been compounded by renewed troubles at Blue Owl over asset sales, triggering a sharp selloff in shares of alternative asset managers with a footprint in the private credit market.

The shift in sentiment is testing a corner of the alternatives market that has swelled into a roughly $2 trillion juggernaut in recent years.

"As we enter 2026, the private credit landscape is facing volatile macroeconomic conditions, shifting flows in the traded and non-traded BDC (Business Development Company) market, and accelerating technological change - particularly around AI," Goldman said.

ASSESSING AI IMPACT

The firm disclosed that GS Credit's exposure to enterprise software credit was about 15.5% at the end of the third quarter, toward the low end of the range reported by its peers.

Investors have been grappling with the prospect of AI disruption for weeks, with many increasingly concerned that the technology has shifted from an efficiency and productivity tailwind for the software sector to a potential existential threat.

Goldman said it has been assessing the impact of AI on the software space for years and passed on its first deal due to AI concerns in October 2023.

"We agree with the perspective that AI is significantly lowering development costs which will lead to increased competitive intensity for incumbent software companies," it said in the letter.

Goldman added that it invests in businesses that show "structural advantages and incumbency moats" that may be difficult for new entrants to displace.

The company said it rolled its first internal framework to evaluate AI disruption risk in early 2025.

"We do not underestimate the risk of AI disruption," it added.

data.title: QIA, Visa and ADIA set to anchor SoftBank's PayPay IPO, sources say
data.description:
Key points:
  • PayPay targets up to $14 billion valuation in IPO
  • SoftBank seeks funds for AI investments through asset sales
  • PayPay partners with Visa to expand in US

By Echo Wang

A group of global investors including Qatar Holdings, an investment arm of Qatar Investment Authority, Visa and Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, is preparing to invest more than $200 million as cornerstone investors in the U.S. initial public offering by SoftBank's PayPay, according to two people familiar with the matter.

PayPay, a Japanese digital payments provider, is targeting a valuation of up to $14 billion in the offering, one of the people said, in what could be the biggest listing for a Japanese company on a U.S. stock exchange.

The source declined to be identified as the information had not been publicly disclosed. The sources cautioned that no final commitment has been made, and the size, terms of the potential cornerstone investments and the valuation of the deal are being discussed and could change.

PayPay plans to list on the Nasdaq next month, one of the people said, adding SoftBank hopes that bringing cornerstone investors on board will boost the IPO’s appeal. The IPO was initially expected in December, but was delayed by a prolonged U.S. government shutdown that slowed the regulatory process.

PayPay, SoftBank, Qatar Holdings, Visa and ADIA did not immediately respond to requests for comment.

Reuters first reported over two years ago that SoftBank was considering a U.S. listing for PayPay.

SOFTBANK GENERATING FUNDS FOR AI SPENDING

The planned IPO of PayPay comes at a pivotal moment for SoftBank Group, which has gone all-in on artificial intelligence. The Japanese conglomerate has committed $30 billion to OpenAI, building on a roughly $41 billion investment it said it completed in December for an estimated 11% stake, Reuters reported. To help fund its AI investments, CEO Masayoshi Son has sold billions of dollars' worth of assets, including the company’s $5.8 billion stake in Nvidia and $4.8 billion of T-Mobile U.S. shares. The PayPay listing - the first U.S. listing for a SoftBank-majority business since Arm Holdings - could provide a timely cash boost for the conglomerate.

Earlier this month, PayPay said it had entered a partnership with Visa, as the Japanese payments company seeks to expand into the U.S.

Jointly formed by SoftBank and Yahoo Japan in 2018, PayPay has helped accelerate Japan's digital transformation, encouraging consumers to move away from cash by offering rebates on payments through its mobile app. Just over seven years since its founding, PayPay has rapidly expanded and grown into one of Japan's most widely used payment platforms, amassing roughly 72 million registered users as of December 31.

data.title: Software Company Credit Woes Are an Equity Problem: Carlyle CEO — Market Talk
data.description: Investor fears that private-credit fund managers may suffer losses on loans to software companies--many of which were the subject of buyouts several years ago--reflect not only potential disruption of those businesses by artificial intelligence advances but also a decline in their valuations as well as the debt loads they carry, Carlyle CEO Harvey Schwartz says during a presentation to shareholders and security analysts. "This is not about direct lending. This is about businesses being bought at really, really high multiples" in 2021 and 2022, before interest rates rose sharply, he says. "Those multiples have systematically come down a bit before this new concern around AI," he adds. "It's the collision of those multiples with leverage-it's actually an equity problem-which is then transferring up the capital structure potentially to a direct lending problem." (luis.garcia@wsj.com; @lhvgarcia)

data.title: PDF Solutions Is Maintained at Buy by DA Davidson
data.description: This news item displays a headline only and has no other text.

data.title: CBOT wheat rallies to 1-year high as US-Iran tensions ignite short covering
data.description:
Chicago Board of Trade wheat futures jumped to a one-year peak on Friday as concerns about U.S.-Iran tensions triggered short covering by funds that held a large net short position in the market, traders said.

  • Technical buying accelerated gains as futures topped multi-month highs posted at the beginning of the week.

  • Commodities markets have been unsettled as investors fret about inconclusive talks on Thursday between Washington and Tehran, despite mediator Oman's talk of progress.

  • Rain and mild weather in the U.S. Plains farm belt have eased concerns about U.S. winter wheat crop conditions.

  • Ratings of French soft wheat crops showed 84% were in good or excellent condition by February 23, down from 88% a week earlier and up from 73% a year ago, farm office FranceAgriMer said on Friday.

  • CBOT May soft red winter wheat (WK26) ended 17 cents higher at $5.91-1/2 a bushel, after peaking at $5.97, the highest level for a most-active contract since February 24, 2025. The contract was up 1.9% in the week, its third straight weekly gain.

  • K.C. May hard red winter wheat (KWK26) last traded 21-1/4 cents higher at $5.83-1/2 per bushel, and Minneapolis May spring wheat (MWEK26) added 12-3/4 cents to close at $6.11-1/2 per bushel.

data.title: United's stock is having its worst day in months on rising oil prices, market jitters
data.description:
By CLAUDIA ASSIS

United Airlines' stock leads S&P 500 decliners

United Airlines' stock was on track for its worst percentage decline since April.

United Airlines' stock was leading S&P 500 index decliners on Friday and heading for its worst drop in 10 months, with other airline stocks also seeing steep declines amid rising oil futures prices and increased market jitters.

United shares (UAL) were on pace for their largest one-day percentage decline since April 10, when they fell 11%. Shares of Delta Air Lines (DAL) and American Airlines (AAL) were down about 6% each.

Shares of Southwest Airlines (LUV) were down more than 3% even as analysts at Cowen raised their rating on the stock to buy on Friday and praised the industry's backdrop. Such ratings changes usually provide a boost for a company's shares.

Oil futures jumped on Friday after nuclear talks between the U.S. and Iran in Geneva ended with no concrete agreements. Negotiations are set to resume next week.

Many airlines shield themselves from volatility in the price of fuel, which makes up a large part of their operational costs, by hedging it, usually using financial derivatives to try to spread their risk. But there has been a clear negative correlation between oil futures prices and airline stocks in recent years.

Signs that inflation may persist and broader fears about artificial intelligence and tech stocks were also at play for U.S. equities, with some fearing that March will be another tumultuous month for the market.

U.S. airlines enjoy broad-based demand and capacity is "rational," the Cowen analysts said in their note about Southwest. The "rising industry tide" bodes well for the company, they said.

The airline for years stuck with a one-size-fits-all approach that fell out of sync with competitors, which dove deeper into tiered fares and charging for different services as a way to drum up more profits.

Amid pressure from activist investors, Southwest announced sweeping changes a couple of years ago, including the end of its hallmark policies of open seating and no fees for checked baggage. It started charging baggage fees earlier this year, while extra-legroom and assigned-seating options went live in January.

-CLAUDIA ASSIS

This content was created by MarketWatch, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. MarketWatch is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.
